title: iconic Reno arch font
content:
Hi,  
I'm trying to identify the font in the iconic Reno arch, [http://www.zazzle.com/reno\_sign\_white\_photo-190514313624163826](http://web.archive.org/web/20150319050855/http:/www.zazzle.com/reno_sign_white_photo-190514313624163826 "http://www.zazzle.com/reno\_sign\_white\_photo-190514313624163826")

Please help if you know it!
author: JosieLuci

comments.content:
Don't know the original name (if it exists) and rather a custom (neon) signage than a font to me.  
Not perfect (3-lined) but you may like [Mexcellent](http://web.archive.org/web/20150319050855/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/typodermic/mexcellent) as substitute.

Almost the same design but only three lines T26 FGroove [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/t26/fgroove/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150319050855/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/t26/fgroove/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/t26/fgroove/")  
Don

Five lines, with somewhat similar design Millennium5Lines;

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150319050855im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Millennium5Lines_6499.jpg)
  
Free download from the fontmaker [http://mksd.jp/millennium.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20150319050855/http:/mksd.jp/millennium.html "http://mksd.jp/millennium.html")  
Don
Also triline but adding [Pump Triline](http://web.archive.org/web/20150319050855/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/pump-lt/triline) to the list.
It was almost certainly done by hand. Not very competently, either—the lack of undershoot on the O betrays lack of lettering knowledge.
Thanks everyone. The Mexcellent font seems to be the closest sub. I think you're right Thomas, it was probably done by hand.
